etymology.description: 杨(楊, poplar; surname Yang) + 斌(refined; cultured) = personal name “Yang Bin”.
etymology.interpretation: Common male Chinese name: 杨 is a high-frequency surname, and 斌 conveys refinement or combined civil and martial virtues. In use, it refers to a specific individual named Yang Bin.
etymology.simplification: 楊 → 杨 by simplifying the phonetic component 昜 (as in 揚→扬), reducing strokes; 斌 is unchanged. Mainland uses simplified in names; Taiwan/HK use traditional.

parts.english: poplar; surname Yang; aspen; a kind of tree
refined; cultured; combining civil and martial virtues; elegant

examples.chinese: 杨斌明天来北京出差(楊斌明天來北京出差)。
examples.pinyin: Yáng Bīn míngtiān lái Běijīng chūchāi.
examples.english: Yang Bin will come to Beijing on a business trip tomorrow.

examples.chinese: 我昨天见到了杨斌(我昨天見到了楊斌)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuótiān jiàn dào le Yáng Bīn.

examples.chinese: 请把文件发给杨斌(請把文件發給楊斌)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bǎ wénjiàn fā gěi Yáng Bīn.
examples.english: Please send the document to Yang Bin.
